name: upper abdominal lymphadenopathy
description: Upper abdominal lymphadenopathy refers to the enlargement of lymph nodes in the upper abdominal region, which can be detected via imaging modalities. In radiologic evaluation, it is characterized by the presence of enlarged lymph nodes with a short-axis diameter typically greater than 1 cm on cross-sectional imaging, with CT and MRI.

values.name: absent
values.description: No upper abdominal lymphadenopathy is present.

values.name: indeterminate
values.description: Cannot determine whether upper abdominal lymphadenopathy is present.

values.name: unknown
values.description: It indicates uncertainty regarding whether upper abdominal lymphadenopathy is present.

attributes.name: location
attributes.description: This refers to the anatomical region where upper abdominal lymphadenopathy is situated.

values.name: right common iliac lymph node group
left common iliac lymph node group
